ë§ì¶¤ë¶„ì–‘í•„í„°(Android iOS)ë¼ëŠ” ì•±ì—ì„œ ë°±ì—”ë“œ íŒŒíŠ¸ë¥¼ ë‹´ë‹¹í•˜ì—¬ ìë°”, ìŠ¤í”„ë§ ë¶€íŠ¸ ê¸°ë°˜ìœ¼ë¡œ ì¶œì‹œí•˜ì—¬ ìš´ì˜ì¤‘ì…ë‹ˆë‹¤.

ì‹ ìƒ ì•±ì´ë‹¤ ë³´ë‹ˆ ê²¬ê³ í•œ ì½”ë“œ ë³´ë‹¤ëŠ” ê¸°ëŠ¥êµ¬í˜„ ì¤‘ì‹¬ìœ¼ë¡œ ì¼ë‹¨ ëŒì•„ê°€ê²Œ í•˜ì!ë¼ëŠ” ìƒê°ìœ¼ë¡œ ë¹ ë¥´ê²Œ ì½”ë“œë¥¼ ì§œê³  ë°°í¬í•˜ëŠ” ê²ƒì„ ë°˜ë³µí•˜ê³  ìˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤.

ì´í›„ ì´ê²ƒë“¤ì´ í° ë¶€ë§¤ë‘ìœ¼ë¡œ ëŒì•„ì˜¬ ë•Œê°€ ë§ì´ ìˆì—ˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤. ì˜ˆë¥¼ ë“¤ì–´ ì™¸ë¶€ APIë¥¼ ì‚¬ìš©í•˜ëŠ” ë¶€ë¶„ì—ì„œì˜ ì¥ì• ê°€ ì„œë¹„ìŠ¤ë¡œ ì¥ì• ì „íŒŒê°€ ë˜ëŠ” ê²½ìš°, ì´í›„ ë²„ê·¸ë¦¬í¬íŒ…ì´ ë“¤ì–´ì™€ ë¡œì§ì„ ìˆ˜ì •í•´ì•¼í•˜ëŠ” ê²½ìš°, ì´í›„ ë‹¤ì‹œ ì½”ë“œë¥¼ ë´¤ì„ë•Œ í•œëˆˆì— ë“¤ì–´ì˜¤ì§€ ì•ŠëŠ” ë“±â€¦

entry.title: [Think] ë§ì´ í†µí•˜ëŠ” ê°œë°œìë˜ê¸°
entry.content:
ì§€ê¸ˆê¹Œì§€ ì—¬ëŸ¬ IT (web/app) í”„ë¡œì íŠ¸ë¥¼ í•˜ë©´ì„œ _â€œìƒëŒ€ë°©ì€ ì™œ ë‚´ë§ˆìŒì„ ëª°ë¼ì¤„ê¹Œìš”?â€_ë¼ëŠ” ë§ì´ ë¹„ë‹¨ ì—°ì• ì—ì„œë§Œ ì‚¬ìš©ë˜ëŠ” ê²ƒì€ ì•„ë‹ˆë¼ëŠ” ê²ƒì„ ì•Œê²Œë˜ì—ˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤â€¦. :(

ê°™ì€ í•œêµ­ì–´ë¡œ ì˜ì‚¬ì†Œí†µì„ í•¨ì—ë„ ë¶ˆêµ¬í•˜ê³  ì§êµ°ê³¼ ì§êµ° ë¼ë¦¬ (ê°œë°œì <=> ê¸°íšì, í”„ë¡ íŠ¸ <=> ë°±ì—”ë“œ ë“±), ê°™ì€ ì§êµ°ë¼ë¦¬ë„ ì •ë§ ì†Œí†µì´ ì˜ë˜ì§€ ì•ŠëŠ” ê²½í—˜ì„ ë§ì´ í–ˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤. íŠ¹íˆ ìš”ì¦˜ê°™ì€ ì½”ë¡œë‚˜ ì‹œêµ­ì—ì„œëŠ” ì›ê²©ìœ¼ë¡œ ì¼ì„ í•˜ëŠ” ê²½ìš°ê°€ ë§ì•˜ê¸° ë•Œë¬¸ì— ë”ìš± í¬ê²Œ ì™€ ë‹¿ëŠ” ê²ƒ ê°™ìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤.

ì»¤ë®¤ë‹ˆì¼€ì´ì…˜ ëŠ¥ë ¥ì€ ITì§êµ°ì—ì„œëŠ” íŠ¹íˆ ì¤‘ìš”í•˜ë‹¤ê³  ìƒê°í•©ë‹ˆë‹¤. í•˜ë‚˜ì˜ ì•±/ì›¹ì„ ì¶œì‹œí•˜ë ¤ê³ ë§Œ í•˜ë”ë¼ë„ ê¸°íšì, ë§ˆì¼€í„°, ë””ìì´ë„ˆ, í”„ë¡ íŠ¸, ë°±ì•¤ë“œ ê°œë°œì ë“±ë“± ìˆ˜ ë§ì€ ë¶„ë“¤ì˜ í˜‘ì—…ì„ í†µí•´ ì´ë£¨ì–´ì§€ê¸° ë•Œë¬¸ì…ë‹ˆë‹¤.

ì´ë²ˆ ê¸€ì—ì„œëŠ” ì§€ê¸ˆê¹Œì§€ ì¼í•˜ë©° ëŠê»´ì˜¨ ê³ ì§ˆì ì¸ ì»¤ë®¤ë‹ˆì¼€ì´ì…˜ ë¬¸ì œìœ í˜•ê³¼ ë°”ëŒì§í•œ í˜‘ì—…ë°©ì‹ì— ëŒ€í•˜ì—¬ ì ì–´ë³´ë„ë¡í•˜ê² ìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤.

ë¬¸ì œì  1. ì ìˆ˜í•¨ ì»¤ë®¤ë‹ˆì¼€ì´ì…˜

ì¼ì„ ì •í•˜ê³  ì´í›„ ë‹¤ì‹œ ë¬¼ì–´ë³´ê¸° ì „ê¹Œì§€ëŠ” ê·¸ ì–´ë– í•œ ë³€ë™ì‚¬í•­ë„ ë§í•˜ì§€ ì•ŠëŠ” ê²½ìš° ì…ë‹ˆë‹¤. ê°€ì¥ í”í•œ ìœ í˜•ì´ ì•„ë‹ê¹Œ ìƒê°ë˜ëŠ”ë°ìš”.

ì˜ˆë¥¼ ë“¤ì–´ ë°ì´í„°ë² ì´ìŠ¤ í™˜ê²½ì„ êµ¬ì¶•í•˜ëŠ” ì—…ë¬´ë¥¼ ë‚´ì¼ ìì •ê¹Œì§€ ëë‚´ê¸°ë¡œ í•œ ê²½ìš°, ë¬¸ì œê°€ ìƒê²¨ ê·¸ë•Œê¹Œì§€ ì¼ì„ ëë‚´ê¸° ì–´ë µê±°ë‚˜ êµ¬í˜„ì— ë³€ë™ì‚¬í•­ì´ ìƒê²¼ìŒì—ë„ ë‹¤ìŒ ë…¼ì˜ ë•Œê¹Œì§€ í˜¹ì€ ë¬¼ì–´ë³´ê¸° ì „ê¹Œì§€ ë§í•˜ì§€ ì•Šê³  ì ìˆ˜í•¨ ì²˜ëŸ¼ í˜¼ìë§Œì˜ ë¹„ë°€ë¡œ? ê°„ì§í•˜ëŠ” ê²½ìš°ë¥¼ ìì£¼ ë³´ì•˜ìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤.

ì´ëŸ´ ê²½ìš° ê´€ë ¨ ì¼ì •, ë° êµ¬í˜„ ë˜í•œ ëª¨ë‘ ë³€ê²½ë˜ì–´ì•¼í•´ì„œ ì´í•´ê´€ê³„ìê°€ ëª¨ë‘ì˜ í•©ì˜ê°€ í•„ìš”í•œë°ìš”. ë§ˆê°ê¸°í•œì´ ë‹¤ë˜ì–´ì„œì•¼ ì—…ë¬´ê°€ ë‹¤ ëë‚˜ì§€ ì•Šì•˜ê³ , ëª…ì„¸ ë˜í•œ ë°”ë€Œì–´ ìˆë‹¤ëŠ” ê²ƒì„ ì•Œì•˜ë‹¤ë©´ ì–´ë–¨ê¹Œìš”â€¦.? ê°„ë‹´ì´ ì„œëŠ˜í•´ì§€ëŠ” ì¼ì´ ì•„ë‹ ìˆ˜ ì—†ìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤.

ë¬¸ì œì  2. ì§ˆë¬¸í•˜ì§€ ì•ŠëŠ” í•œêµ­ì¸

â€˜ì§ˆë¬¸í•˜ì§€ ì•ŠëŠ” í•œêµ­ì¸â€™ ìµíˆ ìš°ë¦¬ê°€ ì•Œê³  ìˆëŠ” ë¬¸ì œë¡œ ìš°ë¦¬ë‚˜ë¼ êµìœ¡ì˜ íŠ¹ì„±ìƒ ìš°ë¦¬ëŠ” ì§ˆë¬¸ì„ ìƒì–´ë²„ë¦° ì‚¬íšŒì—ì„œ ì‚´ì•„ ì™”ìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤.

í˜‘ì—…ì— ìˆì–´ì„œë„ ì´ëŸ¬í•œ ê²½ìš°ë¥¼ ë§ì´ ë³´ì•˜ìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤. ì˜ˆë¥¼ ë“¤ì–´ í•´ì»¤í†¤ì— ì°¸ì—¬í•´ì„œ ë‹¤ë¥¸ ë¶„ì—ê²Œ Aë¼ëŠ” ì—…ë¬´ë¥¼ ë¶€íƒí–ˆì„ ë•Œ, ëª¨ë¥´ëŠ” ê²ƒì„ ëª¨ë¥¸ë‹¤ê³  í•˜ì§€ ì•Šê³  ëê¹Œì§€ í˜¼ìí•˜ë ¤ê³  í•˜ë‹¤ê°€ ê²°êµ­ íŒ€ ì „ì²´ê°€ í”„ë¡œì íŠ¸ë¥¼ ì™„ìˆ˜í•˜ëŠ” ê²ƒì— ì‹¤íŒ¨í•˜ê²Œ ë˜ëŠ” ê²½ìš° ì…ë‹ˆë‹¤.

ê°ì ìì‹ ì˜ ë§ì€ ì¼ ë˜í•œ ë²…ì°¨ê¸°ì— ë‹¤ë¥¸ íŒ€ì›ì—ê²Œ ë¨¼ì € ë‹¤ê°€ê°€ â€œë­ ë„ì™€ë“œë¦´ê¹Œìš”?â€ ë¼ëŠ” ë§ì„ í•˜ê¸° ì‰½ì§€ ì•Šì€ ìƒí™©ì´ ìì£¼ ìˆë‹¤ ìƒê°í•˜ëŠ”ë°ìš”.

ì´ëŸ° ê²½ìš° ì´ˆë³´ì ë¶„ë“¤ì€ ë³¸ì¸ì´ í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆëŠ”ë°ê¹Œì§€ ìµœì„ ì„ ë‹¤í•´ì„œ í•´ë³´ê³ , â€œAê°€ ë¬¸ì œë¼ ì•Œì•„ë³´ì•˜ê³  ê·¸ ê²°ê³¼ B, C, D ê¹Œì§€ í•´ë³´ì•˜ìœ¼ë‚˜ ë¬¸ì œë¥¼ í•´ê²°í•˜ì§€ ëª»í–ˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤. ë‹¤ìŒìœ¼ë¡œ Fë¥¼ ê³ ë ¤í•˜ê³  ìˆëŠ”ë° ì–´ë–»ê²Œ ìƒê°í•˜ì‹œë‚˜ìš”?â€ë¼ê³  ë³¸ì¸ì´ ì§€ê¸ˆê¹Œì§€ ê³ ë¯¼í•œ ê²ƒì„ ì¡°ë¦¬ìˆê²Œ ì •ë¦¬í•˜ì—¬ ì¡°ê¸ˆ ë” ì‹¤ë ¥ì´ ìˆìœ¼ì‹  ë¶„ì—ê²Œ ë¬¼ì–´ ë³¸ë‹¤ë©´ ë³¸ì¸ì˜ ì„±ì¥ì—ë„, íŒ€ì˜ ë°œì „ì—ë„ ëª¨ë‘ ì¢‹ì€ ì¼ì´ ì•„ë‹ê¹Œ í•©ë‹ˆë‹¤.

ê´€ë ¨í•˜ì—¬ ì–´ë–¤ ì‹œë‹ˆì–´ ë¶„ì˜ ë§ì”€ì´ ì¸ìƒ ê¹Šì—ˆëŠ”ë°ìš”. â€œì‹ ì…ì€ ì–´ë–¤ ì¼ì„ í•´ì•¼í•˜ë‚˜ìš”?â€ ë¼ëŠ” ì§ˆë¬¸ì— â€œì‹ ì…ì€ ì§ˆë¬¸í•˜ëŠ” ê²ƒì´ ì£¼ëœ ì—…ë¬´ë¼ê³  ìƒê°í•©ë‹ˆë‹¤.â€ë¼ê³  ë‹µë³€í•´ì£¼ì…¨ë˜ ê²ƒì´ ê¸°ì–µì— ë‚¨ìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤.

ë¬¸ì œì  3. ìœ ì•„ë…ì¡´

ë³¸ì¸ì´ í˜‘ì—…í•˜ê¸° ê°€ì¥ í˜ë“  ìœ í˜•ì´ ì•„ë‹ê¹Œ ìƒê°í•˜ëŠ”ë°ìš”â€¦ ì„¤ë“ë  ì¤€ë¹„ê°€ ë˜ì§€ ì•Šì€ ë¶„ê³¼ í† ì˜ë¥¼ í•˜ëŠ” ê²ƒ ë§Œí¼ ê³ í†µìŠ¤ëŸ¬ìš´ ê²ƒì´ ì—†ëŠ” ê²ƒ ê°™ìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤.

ì˜ˆë¥¼ ë“¤ì–´ Java í”„ë¡œì íŠ¸ì— JPA ORMì„ ë„ì…í•˜ëŠ” ì•ˆê±´ì´ ë‚˜ì™”ë‹¤ê³ í•˜ë©´ JPA íŠœë‹í•˜ê¸° í˜ë“ ë° ë­í•˜ëŸ¬ ê·¸ëŸ° ê²ƒì„ ì“°ë‚˜ìš”? MyBatisë¥¼ ì™œ ì•ˆì“°ì‹œë‚˜ìš”? (ì–¼ë§ˆì „ì— ë“¤ì€ ì´ì•¼ê¸°â€¦.) ë¼ëŠ” ë“±â€¦ ë³¸ì¸ë§Œì˜ í™•ê³ í•œ ì˜ê²¬ì´ ìˆì–´ ì´ì•¼ê¸°ë¥¼ ë“¤ì„ ì¤€ë¹„ê°€ ë˜ì§€ ì•Šì€ ë¶„ë“¤ ì¢…ì¢… ë³´ê³¤í•©ë‹ˆë‹¤.

ìœ„ ì˜ˆì‹œì—ì„œ jpaê°€ ë¬´ì¡°ê±´ ì¢‹ë‹¤ë¼ê¸° ë³´ë‹¤ë„, â€˜AëŠ” ì˜³ê³  BëŠ” ì•„ë‹ˆì•¼â€™ ë¼ëŠ” ë‹¨ì–¸ì ì¸ íƒœë„ëŠ” íŒ€ ì „ì²´ì— ë„ì›€ì´ ë˜ì§€ ì•ŠëŠ”ë‹¤ê³  ìƒê°í•©ë‹ˆë‹¤.

entry.content:
í‰ì†Œ í† ë¹„ë‹˜ì˜ ìœ íŠœë¸Œë¥¼ ì´ë™í•˜ë©° í•­ìƒ ë“£ê³  ìˆëŠ”ë°ìš”, ê·¸ ì¤‘ ë°±ê¸°ì„  ë‹˜ì´ ê²ŒìŠ¤íŠ¸ë¡œ ë‚˜ì˜¤ì‹  í¸ì—ì„œ ê¸°ì„  ë‹˜ì´ í•´ì£¼ì‹  ë§ì”€ì´ í¬ê²Œ ê³µê°ì´ ë˜ì—ˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤.

â€œì²˜ìŒì—ëŠ” ëˆ„ê°€ ë³´ê² ì–´~ë¼ëŠ” ìƒê°ìœ¼ë¡œ ê·¸ëƒ¥ ê¾¸ì¤€í•˜ê²Œ ê³µë¶€í•œ ë‚´ìš©ì„ ì˜¬ë¦´ ë•ŒëŠ” ê¾¸ì¤€í•˜ê²Œ ë¸”ë¡œê·¸ë¥¼ í•  ìˆ˜ ìˆì—ˆëŠ”ë°(ì‹¤ì œë¡œ í¬ìŠ¤íŒ…ì´ 3000ê±´ ì´ìƒâ€¦.), ì œ ë¸”ë¡œê·¸ë¥¼ ë³´ëŠ” ì‚¬ëŒì´ ë§ì•„ì§€ë©° ë‚˜ë§Œ ì•„ëŠ” ìƒˆë¡œìš´ ê²ƒì„ ì¨ì•¼ í•œë‹¤ëŠ” ë¶€ë‹´ê°ì´ ë“¤ë©´ì„œ ë¸”ë¡œê·¸ ê¸€ì„ ì•ˆ ì“°ê¸° ì‹œì‘í•œ ê²ƒ ê°™ì•„ìš”.â€

ì´ ì´ì•¼ê¸°ë¥¼ ë“£ê³  ì € ë˜í•œ â€˜ë‚´ê°€ ì™œ ê¾¸ì¤€í•˜ê²Œ ë¸”ë¡œê·¸ë¥¼ í•˜ì§€ ëª»í–ˆì„ê¹Œâ€™ë¥¼ ëŒì´ì¼œ ë³´ë©° ë„ˆë¬´ ì˜í•˜ë ¤ê³  í–ˆë˜ ê²ƒì´ ì›ì¸ì´ë¼ëŠ” ìƒê°ì´ ë“¤ì—ˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤.

ê°?ì„ ì¡ê³  ì¢‹ì€ ê¸€ì„ ì¨ì„œ ì‚¬ëŒë“¤ì—ê²Œ ì“¸ëª¨ìˆëŠ” ê¸€ì„ ì¨ì•¼ í•œë‹¤ëŠ” ìƒê°ì— ì—„ì²­ ì—¬ìœ ê°€ ìˆëŠ” ë‚ ì´ ì•„ë‹ˆë©´ ì•„ì˜ˆ ì“°ì§€ ì•Šê±°ë‚˜, ì¨ë„ ê¸°ì¡´ì— ì´ë¯¸ ì‘ì„±í•´ë³¸ ì•Œê³ ë¦¬ì¦˜ ì½”ë“œë¥¼ ë‹¨ìˆœ í¬ìŠ¤íŒ…í•˜ëŠ” ìˆ˜ì¤€ì˜ ê¸€ë“¤ì„ ì˜¬ë¦¬ê¸° ê¸‰ê¸‰í–ˆë˜ ê²ƒì€ ì•„ë‹ê¹Œ? ë¼ëŠ” ìƒê°ì´ ë“­ë‹ˆë‹¤.

Better Late Than Neverë¼ëŠ” ì˜ì–´ì†ë‹´ê³¼ ê°™ì´ ëŠ¦ê²Œë¼ë„ í•˜ëŠ” ê²ƒì´ ì•ˆ í•˜ëŠ” ê²ƒë³´ë‹¤ ë‚«ê¸°ì— ì•ìœ¼ë¡œëŠ” ì˜ ì¨ì•¼ê² ë‹¤ëŠ” ìƒê°ì„ ë²„ë¦¬ê³  ëŒ€ë‹¨í•œ ê¸€ì´ ì•„ë‹ˆë”ë¼ë„ ê³µë¶€í•˜ê³  ë°°ìš´ ê²ƒì„ ê¾¸ì¤€í•˜ê²Œ ë¸”ë¡œê·¸ ê¸€ë¡œ ì“°ê² ë‹¤ê³  ë‹¤ì§í•´ë´…ë‹ˆë‹¤.

entry.title: Binary Search with python
entry.content:
Will be added!

Binary Search algorithm

def binary_search(array, target, start, end):
    while start <= end:
        mid = (start+end)//2
        if array[mid] == target:
            return mid
        elif array[mid] >= target:
            end = mid - 1
        else:
            start = mid + 1
    return None

This post is part of Python-Team-Notes for coding test posting that I posted. If you have any questions or mistakes regarding the code, please point it out!
entry.summary: Introduce binary search algorithm with simple python code

entry.title: DFS(Depth-First Search) with python
entry.content:
BFS&DFS are probably one of the most frequent and important types of questions in various interviews and coding tests. Iâ€™ve also encountered this type every time through several coding tests so far.

In this post, I would like to post about the DFS (Breadth-First Search) algorithm. I try to make it as simple as possible with Python, so I hope it helps a lot of people!ğŸ™

DFS (Depth-First Search) algorithm

def dfs(graph, v, visited):
    visited[v] = True

    for i in graph[v]:
        if not visited[v]:
            dfs(graph, i, visited)

This post is part of Python-Team-Notes for coding test posting that I posted. If you have any questions or mistakes regarding the code, please point it out!
entry.summary: Introduce DFS (Dreadth-First Search) algorithm with simple python code

entry.title: BFS(Breadth-First Search) with python
entry.content:
BFS&DFS are probably one of the most frequent and important types of questions in various interviews and coding tests. Iâ€™ve also encountered this type every time through several coding tests so far.

In this post, I would like to post about the BFS (Breadth-First Search) algorithm. I try to make it as simple as possible with Python, so I hope it helps a lot of people!ğŸ™

BFS (Breadth-First Search) algorithm

from collections import deque


def bfs(graph, start, visited):
    q = deque([start])
    visited[start] = True
    # 1. Basic
    while q:
        v = q.popleft()
        for i in graph[v]:
            if not visited[i]:
                q.append(i)
                visited[i] = True

    # 2. Check by distance
    dist = 0
    while q:
        dist += 1
        # You can check the client by dist by hanging the for statement 
        # inside the while statement in this way.
        for _ in range(len(q)):
            x, y = q.popleft()
            for i in range(4):
                nx, ny = x+dx[i], y+dy[i]
                if 0 <= nx < N and 0 <= ny < N and (visited[nx][ny] == False) and B[nx][ny] != 1:
                    q.append((nx, ny))
                    visited[nx][ny] = True
                    if B[nx][ny] == -1:
                        heapq.heappush(client_pq, (nx, ny, dist))

This post is part of Python-Team-Notes for coding test posting that I posted. If you have any questions or mistakes regarding the code, please point it out!
entry.summary: Introduce BFS (Breadth-First Search) algorithm with simple python code

entry.title: Useful parsing skill with python
entry.content:
In a real coding test, there are many difficulties in conditioning simple string processing. Python can use a variety of built-in functions and regular expressions for string data types as a basic built-in library, so with a few simple taps, you can use them very well.

Extract only the number of digits in a string into dictionary

number_cnt = Counter(re.findall('\d+', string))

Change to All Alphabet Case

# Change to Lowercase
string.lower()

# Change to uppercase
string.upper()

Determine if a string consists only of alphabets or numbers

# Determine if it is made up of only alphabets
"abcd".isalpha() # True
"ab2d".isalpha() # False

# Determine if it consists only of numbers
"123".isdigit() # True
"ab123".isdigit() # False

# Determine if it consists only of alphabets or numbers
"123abc".isalnum() # True
"123##ab".isalnum() # False

regular expression examples

See the link below for full information. Only examples from real problems are summarized.

Well-organized documents

import re
from collections import Counter

# Returns if non-alphabet characters are contained in it
string = "12 #abc# 123"
result = re.findall('[^a-zA-Z]+', string)
print(result) # ['12 #', '# 123']

# Returns the number and number that appears in the string in dict form
string = "{{2},{2,1},{2,1,3},{2,1,3,4}}"
result = Counter(re.findall('\d+', string))
print(result) # Counter({'2': 4, '1': 3, '3': 2, '4': 1})

This post is part of Python-Team-Notes for coding test posting that I posted. If you have any questions or mistakes regarding the code, please point it out!
entry.summary: Introduce various useful parsing technique for real coding test

entry.title: [ML] SRGAN one page summary
entry.content:
1. Problem

As time goes by, the quantitative measurement like MSE, PSNR in single-image super-resolution is improved by the breakthrough of CNN based deep neural network. Even though It is still hard to get finer texture details at large upscaled SR images. Because there are some limitations of earlier approaches. By presenting SRGAN, the authors try to solve its problem.

Figure 1: MSE loss tends to minimize loss by averaging of a possible solution. It hard to match finer texture details in existing CNN based network. But as seen in the figure, GAN generates one of possible solution distribution. Itâ€™s easy to get finer texture detail even in large- scaled SR images.

2. Solution

It is the main contribution of this paper to introduce the perceptual loss function with GAN.

Equation 1: It is the loss function of GAN. Both of the terms, that content loss, and adversarial loss use perceptual loss that is calculate loss with feature map extracted from VGG net, not a point pixel result value. By considering two-term at once, It can get an SR image that has finer texture detail.

Equation 2: Content loss used for preventing arbitrary generation result by calculating loss LR image from generator and HR image.

Equation3: Itâ€™s a common GAN loss. log(1-D) is original form, but usually itâ€™s written -log(D). Because It is easy to train.

3. Result

Figure 2: Compare with the others, it seems like SRGAN gives us a much sharp HR image that has a marginally high MOS value. Nonetheless, SRResNet has high PSNR and SSIM. The reason is that, As I mark in the image, GAN gives us a noise result that is not the same as the original image. It is one of the characteristics of GAN model. The reason is that learn the distribution of data, and generate a result. So, there is a hardship to constrain generation.

4. Opinion

The loss is a super important factor in model training. SRGAN uses perceptual loss. It means that the feature map extracted from the network is super important. What if using a more advanced network than VGG net?

All credit by Ledig et al., â€œPhoto-Realistic Single Image Super Resolution Using a Generative Adversarial Networkâ€., CVPR 2017
entry.summary: I introduce SR-GAN brifely with one page summary
